name: REQUEST: PvM Rogue build for NWN official campaign + expansions
author: endjynn

posts.author: endjynn
posts.content:
Hi folks,

I just bought the NWN Enhanced Edition and this will be my first ever playthrough. Character creation seems to be really complex and I'm struggling a bit with my build. Any help, assistance or suggestions would be much appreciated :)

CONCEPT:
I'd like to play a rogue so that I can disable traps and open locks. I would also like to dual-wield melee weapons and prioritize combat ability. I assume this will be best achieved by building a STR based character rather than DEX but I'm open to suggestions.

1) PvM or PvP
Official campaign and expansions only (offline) so PvM

2) Level cap
Max level at the end of official campaign and expansions (from research I think approx level 1-28)

3) Race preference
Elf (so that I have no movement penalty when making search checks)

4) Class preference
Rogue (for traps + locks)
Possibly multi-class with Fighter for extra combat ability

5) Melee preference
Dual-wield! (preferably something sharp and nasty)

Many thanks! :)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Hi Endjynn - and welcome to the most compulsive, varied game of your life! And, of course, to the Guild.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I was thinking about what third class would be good for this build and I concluded that in this case, you are better off without a third class.  Take 10 Rogue and 10 Fighter pre-epic, and another 10 of each in epic levels.  Since you are dual-wielding, I would go for DEX, rather than STR.   You would get Epic Dodge at level 32, to late for HotU, but still helpful in Sands of Fate (which you can play after HotU to get the rest of the way to level 40) or Mines of Twin Summit (which can follow the OC to take you to level 40).  If you start with 17 DEX and use all 7 general epic feats for great DEX, you will end with 34 DEX.

If you played a Halfling instead, this would be easier because Rogue is the favored class for Halflings.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
He can get Epic Dodge at 27 before the final fight with Big Meph & he will have a pretty big AC throughout the campaign regardless.
Rogue 17 - SD 1 - CoT 10, should be a nice combo for a dexer & without any exp penalty as well.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: You're right.  He could use the general feat at level 27 for Epic Dodge.  That means only 6 Great DEX feats, so you would have to start at 18 DEX to reach 34.  You could start with 20 DEX and reach 36, but that would mean spending 6 points just to gain 2 DEX, weakening everything else.

posts.author: endjynn
posts.content:
Many thanks for all your detailed replies and information :)
I'm going to try and create my character build over the weekend. I'll post here when I have a rough draft and perhaps you guys can give it the once over and see how I did?

Thanks!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You are off to a great start endjynn and kudos for your detailed presentation of your character.
One small thing I noticed is "spring attack", ditch that, you don't need it when a character has full tumble skill.
You also do not need 16 dexterity but only 15, with the extra points you will be able to raise your constitution to 14 instead, since you will be fighting in full plate for best AC.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
As Valerfor says, kudos, endjynn. I remember having to be encouraged (sometimes with sharp sticks) and cajoled into constructing my first build several months after joining the Guild.

I've a couple of small items for discussion, if I may. Valerfor's quite right about full plate, but does that have an impact on stealth and /or HiPS? I just don't seem to recall seeing a fully-armoured HiPS-er before - not it's necessarily a bad thing, of course.

Second, I notice you don't take the Use Magic Device (UMD) skill, and I really, really would. It will enable you to not only use wands and scrolls, but also equip some gear you wouldn't be able to otherwise (eg, Sun Soul boots and the like). I'd probably sacrifice Lore for it (but that depends on the result of the possible stealth issue).

Third (and yes, this is me still playing fast and loose with the term "a couple of items"), it appears you're going for a Strength-based mainly Fighter build. That would mean you'd want the best BAB you can reasonably get pre-epic, particularly as you're D-W-ing, which will drop your AB by 2 for each attack. You're currently on BAB 17, but you could raise it to 18 by taking only 4 Rogue levels (possibly at levels 1, 3, 13 and 18) and taking 3 more Fighter levels - and you'd gain another bonus feat in the process. Improving BAB in epic levels isn't an issue, as it increases by 1 every other level regardless of class, so you could always make up for it then. Yes, you'd lose some skill points, but you'd end up better in combat.

Hope this helps.

Cheers
